vo-dml:model.name: caom2
vo-dml:model.description: This is CAOM version 2: a metadata model for use as the core data model of an astronomical data centre
vo-dml:model.title: Common Archive Observation Model
vo-dml:model.author: Patrick Dowler, Canadian Astronomy Data Centre

enumeration.name: ObservationIntentType
enumeration.description: This enumeration describes the intent of the original creator (usually observer) in acquiring this observation.

literal.name: science
literal.description: The intent of this observation was to create science data.

literal.name: calibration
literal.description: The intent of this observation was to create calibration data.

literal.name: calibration
literal.description: The intent of this observation was to create public outreach content.

enumeration.name: CalibrationLevel

literal.name: PLANNED
literal.description: (-1) A planned data product that does not yet exist.

literal.name: RAW_INSTRUMENTAL
literal.description: (0) Raw data in some opaque instrument-specific format.

literal.name: RAW_STANDARD
literal.description: (1) Raw data in a standard format.

literal.name: CALIBRATED
literal.description: (2) Standard calibration steps have been applied.

literal.name: PRODUCT
literal.description: (3) Additional non-standard calibration steps have been applied.

literal.name: ANALYSIS_PRODUCT
literal.description: (4) A data product output from scientific analysis.

enumeration.name: EnergyBand
enumeration.description: Energyband provides a general set of energy regions that span the electromagnetic spectrum. The set of values and boundaries are taken from the VOResource metadata. \todo{The name(s) are used to capture the literal values from VOResource, but that is not valid for X-ray and Gamma-ray}

enumeration.name: ReleaseType
enumeration.description: The release type is a flag indicating how an artifact is classified to determine access permissions. The name(s) of the literals are intended to capture the serialised value(s).

literal.name: data
literal.description: access permission checks treat the protected item as data

literal.name: meta
literal.description: access permission checks treat the protected item as metadata

dataType.name: VocabularyTerm

attribute.name: namespace
attribute.description: This is the globally unique namespace for the vocabulary where definitions can be found.

attribute.name: term
attribute.description: the word from the vocabulary

dataType.name: CalibrationStatus
dataType.description: This is a proposal for the creation of a IVOA calibration-status vocabulary. This vocabulary can be created using optional terms in the ObsCore standard to describe the calibration of each axis in the data separately. (NEW in CAOM-2.5)

dataType.name: DataProductType
dataType.description: This is the IVOA product-type vocabulary that was extracted from the original ObsCore standard. (CHANGED in CAOM-2.5)

dataType.name: Quality
dataType.description: This is a proposed vocabulary to specify that something is wrong with an observation. Existing usage is confined to a single term: junk.

dataType.name: Status
dataType.description: This is a proposed vocabulary to specify that an an observation did not meet requirements. Existing usage is confined to a single term: fail.

dataType.name: TargetType
dataType.description: This is a proposed vocabulary to specify the general type of a target. Esisting usage includes two terms: object, field.)

dataType.name: DataLinkSemantics
dataType.description: This is the IVOA DataLink Core vocabulary. (CHANGED in 2.5)

dataType.name: PolarizationState
dataType.description: This is a proposed vocabulary to specify constants for the PolarizationState. Existing usage includes terms from the ObsCore polarization states list, plus some extra terms derived from community usage and proposals. (CHANGED from enumeration in CAOM-2.5)

dataType.name: Tracking
dataType.description: This is a proposed vocabulary to specify the tracking mode of the telescope during the acquisition of data. (NEW in CAOM-2.5)

dataType.name: UCD
dataType.description: This is the IVOA UCD1+ vocabulary. (Changed from string in CAOM-2.5)

attribute.name: species
attribute.description: TODO

attribute.name: transition
attribute.description: TODO

dataType.name: Dimension2D
dataType.description: dimension (number of pixels) for a two-dimensional axis

objectType.name: Entity
objectType.description: This is a base class to persistence. The entity attributes are generally set or updated by persistence implementations.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The id is a globally unique identifier (primary key) for an instance.

attribute.name: lastModified
attribute.description: The timestamp of last modification of this entity tracks changes in metadata and supports incremental operations. The timestamp is intended to be set and/or updated when the entity is stored (e.g. in a database).

attribute.name: metaChecksum
metaProducer
attribute.description: This identifier is used to identify the tools used to produce the metadata. It also implicitly applies to child entities with null metaProducer. The form of the URI is not specified; implementations are free to use this to track metadata curation. For example, a pattern like {organisation}:{software name}-{version} is useful to support a variety of operational uses: query for metadata created by a version with a known bug or query for metadata created by an older version of the software and perform updates.

objectType.name: CaomEntity
objectType.description: This is an extension of the base Entity class to support accumulated metadata checksums and accumulated lastModified timestamps for entities with child entities.

attribute.name: maxLastModified
attribute.description: The maximum last modification timestamp of this entity and all child entities is used to support incremental synchronization (of Observation instances). As with the instance lastModified timestamp above, this timestamp is intended to be set and/or updated when the entity is stored (e.g. in a database).

attribute.name: accMetaChecksum

objectType.name: DeletedArtifactDescriptionEvent
objectType.description: an event signifiying that a previously persisted ArtifactDescription was deleted; this event can be synchronized to propagate deletions; the Entity.id of the event is equal to the Entity.id of the deleted observation and this identifier is used when performing deletions

attribute.name: uri
attribute.description: The logical identifier of the ArtifactDescription: the ArtifactDescription.uri value; this is for informational purposes only

objectType.name: DeletedObservationEvent
objectType.description: an event signifiying that a previously persisted Observation was deleted; this event can be synchronized to propagate deletions; the Entity.id of the event is equal to the Entity.id of the deleted observation and this identifier is used when performing deletions

attribute.name: uri
attribute.description: The logical identifier of the Observation: the Observation.uri value; this is for informational purposes only

objectType.name: Observation
objectType.description: The observation is the top-level metadata structure that describes astronomical data in a data collection.

attribute.name: collection
attribute.description: The name of the data collection to which this observation belongs.

attribute.name: uri
attribute.description: A unique logical identifier for this observation. (NEW in CAOM-2.5) TODO: limit this to one of two forms that support use cases?

attribute.name: uriBucket
attribute.description: This is a short string of hexadecimal digits generated from the uri to support operational use cases (mainly: dividing workload to perform validation in parallel). The value is the first three characters of the hexadecimal representation of SHA-1 of the UTF-8 encoded bytes of the Observation.uri value. (NEW in CAOM-2.5)

attribute.name: metaRelease
attribute.description: This timestamp specifies the point where the metadata for the observation instance is public (can be viewed by anonymous users). A null value means the metadata is nont public.

attribute.name: sequenceNumber
attribute.description: a collection-specific sequence number for observations; re-use or reset is collection specific

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: This describes the general purpose of observation (e.g. FITS OBSTYPE keyword). Existing usage is usually OBJECT for intent = science and other values for intent = calibration.

attribute.name: intent
attribute.description: This is an enumeration that describes the intent of the original creator of the observation.

attribute.name: metaReadGroups
attribute.description: This is a set of groups with read permission on observation metadata for cases when the metadata is non-public (see metaRelease above).

composition.name: algorithm
composition.description: This provides information about the algorithm or process that created this observation.

composition.name: telescope
composition.description: Information about the telescope or facility where this observation was created.

composition.name: instrument
composition.description: Information about the instrument or detector used to acquire the data.

composition.name: environment
composition.description: Information about the environmental conditions at the time of observation.

composition.name: proposal
composition.description: Information about the science proposal that motivated the creation of this observation.

composition.name: target
composition.description: Information about the intended target of the observation.

composition.name: targetPosition
composition.description: Information about the intended target position for this observation. This may differ from the coordinates of the target object itself.

composition.name: requirements
composition.description: Information about the observational requirements specified by the observer or proposal and whether this observation satisfies those requirements.

composition.name: planes
composition.description: The planes within an observation are the different data products that are produced from the observation. For SimpleObservation, there are usually different planes for raw data, calibrated data, etc.

objectType.name: SimpleObservation
objectType.description: A simple observation is created directly by operating a telescope and instrument (for empirical data) or by a process (for simulation data). Existing usage: the Algorithm.name values 'exposure' and 'simulation' are reserved for these cases respectively.

objectType.name: DerivedObservation
objectType.description: A derived observation is an observation created from one or more other observations. Examples of multiple members include: stacks of images combined to increase signal:noise ratio, mosaics combined to increase field-of-view, etc. Examples of single members: subset of comensurally observed data that is attributed/assigned to one proposal or project (with associated permissions).

attribute.name: members
attribute.description: The members are the observations grouped together by the algorithm that defines the derivation. these are the intended components of the composite product, but actual inputs are described by the provenance. Members may be simple or derived observations (arbitrary heirarchy); derived observations with one or more members may be defined such that they only include a subset of each member (they are extracted from the progenitor). Observation.uri values are used here to refer to the member observations.

objectType.name: Plane
objectType.description: A plane is a component of an observation that describes one product of the observation.

attribute.name: uri
attribute.description: A unique logical identifier for this plane. Values of this identifier are used in Plane.provenance.inputs to form a reference from a product to it's progenitors. TODO: limit this to one of two forms that support use cases? (NEW in CAOM-2.5)

attribute.name: metaRelease
attribute.description: This timestamp specifies the point where the metadata for the plane instance is public (can be viewed by anonymous users). A null value means the metadata is not public. The metaRelease timestamp applies to the plane metadata itself and to all artifacts with releaseType=meta.

attribute.name: metaReadGroups
attribute.description: This is a set of groups with read permission on plane metadata for cases when the metadata is non-public (see metaRelease above).

attribute.name: dataRelease
attribute.description: This timestamp specifies the point where the metadata for the plane instance is public (can be viewed by anonymous users). A null value means the metadata is not public. The dataRelease timestamp applies to all artifacts with releaseType=data.

attribute.name: dataReadGroups
attribute.description: This is a set of groups with read permission on plane data for cases when the data is non-public (see dataRelease above).

attribute.name: calibrationLevel
attribute.description: This describes the degree to which the data is calibrated; it is equivalent to the ObsCore calibration level field.

attribute.name: dataProductType
attribute.description: This describes the logical type of data for this product; it is equivalent to the ObsCore data product type field.

composition.name: observable
composition.description: The observable describes the quantity stored in the sample (pixel) values

composition.name: quality
composition.description: This is a flag that indicates the quality of the data. Existing usage is that this is only assigned when there is something wrong with the data and the quality flag indicates roughly what is wrong.

composition.name: metrics
composition.description: Metrics are measured quantities that describe the content rather than the characteristics of the product.

composition.name: position
composition.description: Information about the positional coverage and sampling of the data.

composition.name: energy
composition.description: Information about the energy coverage and sampling of the data.

composition.name: time
composition.description: Information about the time coverage and sampling of the data.

composition.name: polarization
composition.description: Information about the polarization state(s) of the data.

composition.name: custom
composition.description: Information about the a single custom axis and sampling of the data. Since different custom coordinate types can be used with different planes, instances of CustomAxis can only be compared sensibly if they have the same coordinate type. Existing usage is experimental: Faraday Depth or Rotation Measure axes in radio data cubes.

composition.name: uv
composition.description: Information about the UV plane coverage and sampling of the data for interferometric observations.

composition.name: provenance
composition.description: The provenance provides a description how the plane was created and the direct input planes that were used. This is a single-step provenance and not a complete description of all activities that led to this product.

composition.name: artifacts
composition.description: This is the set of component artifacts belonging to this plane.

objectType.name: Artifact
objectType.description: An Artifact is an external stored digital object associated with a Plane. This is typically a file, but could also be a table in a database, a record in a table in a database, etc.

attribute.name: uri
attribute.description: This identifier can be used to interact with an associated data management system. Existing usage: this is an opaque internal identifier that an IVOA DataLink service can convert into a usable link to the data. TODO: In the existing community, each provider of CAOM metadata (and associated data) defines their own URI scheme of the form \begin{verbatim} {scheme}:{scheme-specific-part} \end{verbatim} where the \verb|{scheme-specific-part}| is a relative path (usually human-readable). For example, CADC uses identifiers of like \verb|cadc:CFHT/170100o.fits| while MAST uses the \verb|mast| scheme for identifers starting with \verb|mast:HST/|, \verb|mast:HST/|, etc. There is no formal mechanism to claim or reserve a specific scheme.

attribute.name: uriBucket
attribute.description: This is a short string of hexadecimal digits generated from the uri to support operational use cases (mainly: dividing workload to perform validation in parallel). The value is the first three characters of the hexadecimal representation of SHA-1 of the UTF-8 encoded bytes of the Artifact.uri value. (NEW in CAOM-2.5)

attribute.name: productType
attribute.description: This term describes the relationship of this Artifact to the parent Plane using IVOA DataLink semantics concepts. For example, the primary science data file for a Plane would be described with the term \verb|this|.

attribute.name: releaseType
attribute.description: This field indicates whether this artifact is treated as data or metadata when determining access permission. Existing usage: some collections have small previews (productType=thumbnail) that are considered metadata and are thus viewable by all users.

attribute.name: contentType
attribute.description: This field specifies the serialization format of the resolved artifact (MIME type).

attribute.name: contentLength
attribute.description: This field specifies the size of the stored artifact; for files, this is the file size.

attribute.name: contentChecksum
contentRelease
attribute.description: This timestamp after which content for the artifact is public. If set, this value overrides the permission implied by the releaseType and Plane release dates. Existing usage: MAST?.

attribute.name: contentReadGroups
attribute.description: Thsi is a set of groups that are allowed to access the content of this artifact. If set, thisd overrides the permission implied by the releaseType and PLane release groups. Existing usage: unknown.

attribute.name: descriptionID
attribute.description: This is an identifier to refer to an ArtifactDescription entity. (new in CAOM-2.5) Use case: provide standard descriptions for links in a DataLink response.

objectType.name: ArtifactDescription
objectType.description: Ths entity provides a referenceable description of artifacts for use in DataLink responses. (NEW in CAOM-2.5)

attribute.name: uri
attribute.description: This is the logical identifier for this description used to refer to it from an artifact. Anticipated usage: this is an internal identifier that an IVOA DataLink service can use to lookup a description. TODO: document the informal style also used for Artifact.uri to make sure that these identifiers are globally unique and avoid collisions.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description is a human-readable description of an artifact.

objectType.name: Algorithm
objectType.description: The algorithm is the operation responsible for creating the observation. For a DerivedObservation, this is the algorithm that defines the intended set of members.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The algorithm name defines very high level categories of observations. See SimpleObservation and DerivedObservation for existing use. TBD: publish a list of acceptable values as a machine-readable vocabulary?

objectType.name: Telescope
objectType.description: The telescope describes the facility used to acquire the data for an observation. It implicitly includes the collector(s) (that gather the signal) but not the instrument (see Instrument).

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The common (short) name of the telescope or facility that acquired the empirical observation. TBD: reference to a standard list of names?

attribute.name: geoLocationX
attribute.description: x-coordinate of the geocentric location of the telescope at the time of observation (see FITS WCS Paper III). TBD: since the spectral WCS in Chunk has been removed, this is probobaly obsolete and useless.

attribute.name: geoLocationY
attribute.description: y-coordinate of the geocentric location of the telescope at the time of observation (see FITS WCS Paper III). TBD: since the spectral WCS in Chunk has been removed, this is probobaly obsolete and useless.

attribute.name: geoLocationZ
attribute.description: z-coordinate of the geocentric location of the telescope at the time of observation (see FITS WCS Paper III). TBD: since the spectral WCS in Chunk has been removed, this is probobaly obsolete and useless.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: Additional keywords describe the telescope or telscope configuration at the time of observation. Keywords cannot contain the pipe (|) character: it is reserved for use in persistence systems (e.g. to store all keywords in a single column in a table).

attribute.name: trackingMode
attribute.description: The ttacking mode of the telescope indicates how the telescope moved (or not) during data acquisition (NEW in CAOM-2.5). TODO: refer to an IVOA Tracking vocabulary?

objectType.name: Instrument
objectType.description: The instrument is the device that captures, aggregates, and digitise the signal from the telescope while creating an observation. An instrument could be physical hardware at a telescope (for empirical data) or software that generates it (for simulated data).

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: common name for the instrument

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: Additional keywords describe the instrument or instrument configuration at the time of observation. Keywords cannot contain the pipe (|) character: it is reserved for use in persistence systems (e.g. to store all keywords in a single column in a table).

objectType.name: Environment
objectType.description: The environment is a collection of measured quantities that characterise the conditions when the observation was created.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The seeing is a measure of the atmospheric distortion: full-width-half-max of a point source.

attribute.name: humidity
attribute.description: The humidity is a meaure of the fractional relative humidity [0,1].

attribute.name: elevation
attribute.description: The elevation is the angular elevation above the horizon [0,90].

attribute.name: tau
attribute.description: Tau is a measure of the opacity of the atmosphere [0,1].

attribute.name: wavelengthTau
attribute.description: The tau (opacity) was measured at this wavelength.

attribute.name: ambientTemp
attribute.description: The ambient temperature is a measurement of the typical temperature at/in the telescope.

attribute.name: photometric
attribute.description: The photometric flag is an indicator that flux and/or color calibration is stable.

objectType.name: Proposal
objectType.description: Proposal is a summary description of the science proposal or programme that initiated the observation. It is expected that a rich proposal model exists elsewhere; this description is to assist data discovery only.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The proposal identifier is a collection-specific identifier for this proposal. If rich proposal model is available, this identifier should be usable to interact with that external system.

attribute.name: pi
attribute.description: The pi is the proper name of the principal investigator for the proposal.

attribute.name: project
attribute.description: This is the name of a (larger scale) project this proposal belongs to. This should be a common (short) name for the project and typically used for larger or long-running projects that include multiple proposals.

attribute.name: title
attribute.description: The title of the proposal as found in a rich proposal model or system.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: Additional keywords describe the scientific area of research or goals of the proposal. Keywords cannot contain the pipe (|) character: it is reserved for use in persistence systems (e.g. to store all keywords in a single column in a table).

attribute.name: reference
attribute.description: The proposal reference is a resolvable identifier for external resource with additional (human-readable) details about the proposal.

objectType.name: Target
objectType.description: The target of an observation is the principle object or area under investigation.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name is a (one of?) common (short) proper name of the target.

attribute.name: targetID
attribute.description: The targetID is a resolvable target identifier. The targetID URI should (must?) be of the form {scheme}:{id} so it can be resolved (for example: naif:170100).

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The target type is typically used to figure out what the target name means and where to look for additional information about it.

attribute.name: redshift
attribute.description: The redshift is the best known cosmological redshift of the target. This value is only used for targets that are extragalactic objects.

attribute.name: standard
attribute.description: The standard flag indicates that the target is typically used as a standard (astrometric, photometric, etc), usually for for calibration observations (see Observation.intent).

attribute.name: moving
attribute.description: The moving flag indicates that the target is a moving object. This is used for solar system objects but not high proper motion stars.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: Additional keywords describe the target and usage depends on the target type. Keywords cannot contain the pipe (|) character: it is reserved for use in persistence systems (e.g. to store all keywords in a single column in a table).

objectType.name: TargetPosition
objectType.description: The target position is the intended position of the observation as described in a proposal. This may or may not be the position of the target itself. The values here are intended for information purposes only and are not intended to be searchable via a spatial coordinate search.

attribute.name: coordsys
attribute.description: The coordinate system of the target coordinates.

attribute.name: equinox
attribute.description: The equinox of the coordinates.

attribute.name: coordinates
attribute.description: The target coordinates in the specified coordinate system and equinox.

objectType.name: Requirements
objectType.description: Requirements is a summary description of whether the observation satisfies the observational requirements specified by the proposal. In general, values of status describe what went wrong and this value is absent if the observation met the requirements.

attribute.name: flag
attribute.description: The flag indicates the reason that the requirements were not satisfied by the observation.

objectType.name: Provenance
objectType.description: description of how this data was produced

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: collection-specific common name of the process

attribute.name: reference
attribute.description: identifier for external resource with proposal details

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: version of the software or process that produced the data

attribute.name: project
attribute.description: name of the project that produced the data; data produced in a uniform way are typically labelled with the same project name

attribute.name: producer
attribute.description: common name of the entity (person, institute, etc) responsible for producing the data

attribute.name: runID
attribute.description: collection-specific identifier for the processing instance that produced the data; this identifier can typcially be traced in log files or logging systems

attribute.name: lastExecuted
attribute.description: timestamp describing when this process last ran and produced data

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.description: additional keywords that describe the processing; this may include both general descriptive words and those specific to this particular execution of the processing; keywords cannot contain the pipe (|) character - it is reserved for use in persistence systems (e.g. to store all keywords in a single column in a table)

attribute.name: inputs
attribute.description: local identifier for input planes; these are the actual inputs that went into the product

objectType.name: Observable
objectType.description: The observable provides a description of the sample (pixel) values.

attribute.name: ucd
attribute.description: The Unified Content Descriptor (UCD) specifies the type of quantity is stored (\verb|phot.count| or \verb|phot.flux;density|).

attribute.name: calibration
attribute.description: The calibration describes the calibration of the observable values using a vocabulary (NEW in CAOM-2.5).

objectType.name: DataQuality
objectType.description: The DataQuality structure holds descriptive data quality information. This is currently limited to a single qualitative flag, but could be expanded in future to include more quantitiatve details.

attribute.name: flag
attribute.description: This file contains a qualitative indicator the data quality.

objectType.name: Metrics
objectType.description: Metrics is a collection of measured quantities that describe the content of the data.

attribute.name: sourceNumberDensity
attribute.description: This metric provides an estimate of the number of sources detected per unit area.

attribute.name: background
attribute.description: This metric provides an estimate of the background level.

attribute.name: backgroundStddev
attribute.description: This metric provides an estimate of the standard deviation in the background level.

attribute.name: fluxDensityLimit
attribute.description: This metric provides an estimate of the flux density with a signal:noise ratio of 10.

attribute.name: magLimit
attribute.description: This metric provides an estimate of the limiting source magnitude with a signal:noise ratio of 10.

attribute.name: sampleSNR
attribute.description: This metric provides an estimate of the signal:noise ratio for a representative subset of samples.

objectType.name: Position
objectType.description: The Position structure describes the positional coverage and sampling of the data.

attribute.name: bounds
attribute.description: The bounds is a spatial boundary that includes the valid data (CHANGED cardinality in CAOM-2.5). This field is typically used for spatial search of data that contains locations or intersects regions on the sky.

attribute.name: samples
attribute.description: The samples provide a detailed footprint of the valid data (CHANGED in CAOM-2.5). The samples may be the same as or a subset of the region described by the bounds (above).

attribute.name: minBounds
attribute.description: The minimum spatial boundary includes the valid data at all values of other axes. This value will be smaller than the (maximum) bounds when the field-of-view varies because it is dependent on another axis such as energy (new in CAOM-2.5).

attribute.name: dimension
attribute.description: The dimension gives the number of separate measurements (pixels) along each spatial axis.

attribute.name: maxRecoverableScale
attribute.description: The maxRecoverableScale is the maximum size of spatial structure (signal) that can be recovered or seen in the data (new in CAOM-2.5). This scale limitation in the data is usually an artifact of spectral filtering in interferometry observations, which is energy-dependent; the interval value gives the range of scales at the extreme values of the energy axis.

attribute.name: resolution
attribute.description: The resolution is a typical/representative spatial resolution (full-width-half-max). In previous versions, this was computed as the mean resolution per pixel.

attribute.name: resolutionBounds
attribute.description: The resolutionBounds describes the range of resolution when it varies across the field-of-view.

attribute.name: sampleSize
attribute.description: The sampleSize is the mean pixel size in the data.

attribute.name: calibration
attribute.description: The calibration describes the calibration of the position axis values using a vocabulary (NEW in CAOM-2.5).

objectType.name: Energy
objectType.description: The Energy structure describes the energy coverage and sampling of the data.

attribute.name: bounds
attribute.description: The bounds is a spectral interval that includes the valid data (CHANGED cardinality in CAOM-2.5). This field is typically used for spectral search of data that contains specific energy values or overlaps a spectral region.

attribute.name: samples
attribute.description: The samples provide a detailed energy coverage of the valid data (CHANGED in CAOM-2.5). The samples may be the same as or a subset of the interval described by the bounds (above).

attribute.name: energyBands
attribute.description: The energyBands contains the standard name of the energy regime(s) included in the data. This names are taken from VOResource (ref). In most cases, the value contains a single energy band, but some data spans the canonical boundary between two adjacent regimes and thus may have two values.

attribute.name: dimension
attribute.description: The dimension gives the number of measurements (pixels) on the energy axis.

attribute.name: resolvingPower
attribute.description: The resolving power is a typical/representative relative spectral resolution of the data. In previous versions, this was the mean resolving power per pixel.

attribute.name: resolvingPowerBounds
attribute.description: The resolving power bounds describes how the resolving power varies with other axis values. The variation may be dependent on position, energy, or time (unspecified here).

attribute.name: resolution
attribute.description: The resolution is a typical/representative absolute spectral resolution of the data (new in CAOM-2.5).

attribute.name: resolutionBounds
attribute.description: The resolution bounds describes how the absolute resolution varies with other axis values. The variation may be dependent on position, energy, or time; the exact dependence is not specified here. (new in CAOM-2.5)

attribute.name: sampleSize
attribute.description: The sampleSize is the mean pixel size in the data.

attribute.name: bandpassName
attribute.description: The bandpass name is a telescope- and instrument-specific name for the energy band(s) included; multiple bands may be included if energies from all specified bands are included in the data (in the sense of union). This is typically a filter name in optical imaging observations.

attribute.name: restwav
attribute.description: The rest energy of the target energy transition (name changed in CAOM-2.5). Use case: something to do with wcs frame conversions...

attribute.name: calibration
attribute.description: The calibration describes the calibration of the energy axis values using a vocabulary (NEW in CAOM-2.5).

attribute.name: transition
attribute.description: The transition is a target energy transition that was observed. Use case: see rest (above). TODO: should this be part of Target?

objectType.name: Time
objectType.description: The Time structure describes the time coverage and sampling of the data.

attribute.name: bounds
attribute.description: The bounds is a time interval that includes the valid data (CHANGED cardinality in CAOM-2.5). This field is typically used for temporal search of data that contains specific time values or overlaps a specific date and time range.

attribute.name: samples
attribute.description: The samples provide a detailed time coverage of the valid data (CHANGED in CAOM-2.5). The samples may be the same as or a subset of the interval described by the bounds (above).

attribute.name: calibration
attribute.description: The calibration describes the calibration of the time axis values using a vocabulary (NEW in CAOM-2.5).

attribute.name: dimension
attribute.description: The dimension gives the number of measurements (pixels) on the time axis.

attribute.name: resolution
attribute.description: The resolution is a typical/representative absolute time resolution of the data (new in CAOM-2.5).

attribute.name: resolutionBounds
attribute.description: The resolution bounds describes how the absolute resolution varies with other axis values. The variation may be dependent on position, energy, or time; the exact dependence is not specified here. (new in CAOM-2.5)

attribute.name: sampleSize
attribute.description: The sampleSize is the mean pixel size in the data.

attribute.name: exposure
attribute.description: The exposure is a typical/representative amount of total time that signal was being collected. In previous versions, this was the mean exposure time per pixel.

attribute.name: exposureBounds
attribute.description: The exposure bounds describes how the exposure time varies with other axis values. The variation is typically dependent on position in DerivedObservation(s), but the exact dependence is not specified here. Use case: stacked image data with partial overlap.

objectType.name: Polarization
objectType.description: The Polarization structure describes the polarization states that are included in the data.

attribute.name: states
attribute.description: standard polarization states included (CHANGED cardinality in CAOM-2.5)

attribute.name: dimension
attribute.description: The dimension is the number of polarization states in the data.

objectType.name: CustomAxis
objectType.description: A custom axis describes an additional axis in the data with a custom coordinate type. Use case: radio cubes with Faraday depth or rotation measure axis.

attribute.name: ctype
attribute.description: The ctype is the coordinate type code as used in the community. This is requivalent in meaning and usage as the FITS (ref) \verb|CTYPE| header keyword.

attribute.name: bounds
attribute.description: The bounds is an interval of the custom coordinate values that includes the valid data (CHANGED cardinality in CAOM-2.5). This field is typically used to search of data that contains specific coordinmate values or overlaps a range of values.

attribute.name: samples
attribute.description: The samples provide a detailed custom coordinate coverage of the valid data (CHANGED in CAOM-2.5). The samples may be the same as or a subset of the interval described by the bounds (above).

attribute.name: dimension
attribute.description: The dimension is the number of samples (pixels) in the data.

objectType.name: Visibility
objectType.description: The Visibility structure provides a description of the UV-plane for interferometry data (new in CAOM-2.5). This information may be present for actual visibility data (Plane.dataProductType \verb|visibility| or for other products (\verb|image| or \verb|cube|) that are derived from interferometry data.

attribute.name: distance
attribute.description: The diastance is an interval specifying the range of distances in the UV plane.

attribute.name: distance
attribute.description: The eccentricity of the distribution of ??? (in [0,1]).

attribute.name: distance
attribute.description: The fractional fill of the distribution of ??? (in [0,1]).
